intro: Boeckhia, commonly known as the water lily of the genus Boeckhia, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Nychthemeraliaceae. These plants are typically found in freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. They are characterized by their floating leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers that bloom at night. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they have a unique structure with a single pistil and stamens. Boeckhia species are generally small in size and play a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
